content: Have compiler folks already seen the proposals in glibc to introduce new aggregate baseline sets of CPU features? Thread at https://sourceware.org/pipermail/libc-alpha/2020-July/116135.html
The plan is to have the dynamic linker search for those so it doesn't have to search for a combinatorial set of features.
Those new baselines will be used by distributions for compiling optimized versions of libraries.
So once the details settle down, and support starts going into LLVM, we should consider adding that support ourselves.
(They'd also be good targets for feature-based function optimizations in the standard library.)
Iâ€™d be much more interested in getting whatever the linkage mechanism based on arbitrary feature detection code work somehow.
Yeah, that would be great to have.
